ags:resource.dc:title: Evaluation quality of planter for accurate seeding

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Zhodnotenie kvality práce sejačiek na presný výsev

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak Agricultural University in Nitra, Nitra, Slovak republic, e-mail: xkrizanm@is.uniag.sk

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Purpose of this work was to assess the seeding quality when using two types of seed drill. Meassuring and evaluation of seeding quality has been done by comparing both types of sowing machine from the perspective of areal placement of seeds after their germination. It was performed at various operation speed so as 7,5 km.h–1, 10 km.h–1 a 12 km.h–1. Those machines to be compared were the seed drill HORSCH Airseeder 9CO and the seed drill PNEUSEJ 6MT designated for drill seeding mainly for winter crops specifically common barley in our case.The results were measured by TfPolyM scheme and evaluated by polygon method. This method is based on setting the siding areas which determine real and ideal space needed for another growth of the plant. For the evaluation of seeding quality were used the photographs made for each working speed separately. Using digital photos we were able to determine the shape factor. The value at seeding drill PNEU-SEJ 6MT ranged from 0,6956 to 0,8921 and the shape factor at HORSCH Airseeder 9CO ranged from 0,6215 to 0,9014. On the basis of these measurements we found out that the size of shape factor changes depending on working speed of seeding drill.
